title: Embodied Collaborative Mathematical Problem-Solving Process Based on Clinical Simulation

context.prior_knowledge: Grasp of basic mathematical concepts and simple collaborative work experience
context.additional_context: Collaborative learning process for professionals in medical/legal/technical fields to apply elementary math concepts to clinical simulation environments, with short-term intensive training to enhance problem-solving skills required in actual work

learning_goals: Learners can solve mathematical problems with over 80% accuracy through embodied collaboration (integration of verbal and spatial behaviors) in clinical simulation environments.
Learners can identify and improve three or more collaboration behavior patterns based on Multimodal Learning Analytics (MMLA).
Learners can design optimal spatial movement paths for each simulation learning phase (preparation-execution-reflection) with 90% accuracy using situational cognitive strategies.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
